alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 9:01PM CST until December 17 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern St. Louis County in northeastern Minnesota... Northeastern Carlton County in northeastern Minnesota... Douglas County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 945 PM CST. * At 859 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Superior, to 6 miles northeast of Canyon, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. * This snow squall is currently impacting the I-35, US-53, and US-2 corridors through the Twin Ports. Locations impacted include... Duluth, Superior, Hermantown, Proctor, Hawthorne, Lake Nebagamon, Maple, Brule, Poplar, Solon Springs, Oliver, Gordon, Boulder Lake, Pike Lake Near Duluth, Wisconsin Point, City of Rice Lake, Amnicon Falls State Park, Canyon, South Range, and McQuade Harbor. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
